author: Special Correspondent
text:
Navy sailor Chief Engineering Mechanic Ashu Singh, who was killed after a fire on board aircraft carrier INS Viraat on Sunday, was given a ceremonial farewell on Monday.

After the honours by the ship’s company at Dabolim in Goa, the mortal remains accompanied by the ship’s officers and sailors left in a Dornier aircraft from Goa to Jaipur. From there the body will be taken to his native place in Nagaur district.

A minor fire broke out in the boiler room of INS Viraat on Sunday when she had berthed at Goa harbour.

While the fire was quickly brought under control, four sailors sustained injury. Ashu got critical after inhaling smoke. He was shifted to the naval hospital at Goa where he suffered a cardiac arrest and died.

Earlier in the day, family members of the Navy personnel had visited the aircraft carrier.

However at the time of the accident “all the families had disembarked and the ship was in the process of shutting down the machinery, including the boiler,” the officer said.
title: Farewell to sailor killed in fire on board INS Viraat
